subject: Real Estate
title: Specific Performance: Forcing a Sale
description: A short lesson to help you apply Specific Performance: Forcing a Sale.

hook.text: You signed the contract. The buyer is ready. But you change your mind. Can you just walk away?

buildup.text: In most contract disputes, courts award money damages. Real estate is different.

discovery.text: Because every property is unique, courts can order 'specific performance' ‚Äî forcing you to complete the sale.

twist.text: This remedy is extremely rare in other areas of law. You can't be forced to sell your car, but you can your house.

climax.text: Specific performance exists because money can't replace a unique location. A substitute doesn't exist.

punchline.text: A court can force you to sell your home.

quiz.question: Why can courts order specific performance for real estate?
options: Every property is unique and can't be substituted
